args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . More than 40,000 workers said to accept deferred resignation offer More than 40,000 people have accepted the Trump administration’s deferred resignation offer, according to a person familiar with the figures who spoke on the condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to speak publicly. A day before the offer expires, the total is double what was first reported by Axios earlier this week but still less than the goal advertised by Elon Musk, the billionaire spearheading President Donald Trump’s vision for a smaller and more loyal workforce. Musk shared a post on X, his social media platform, that claimed that between 5 and 10 percent of employees eligible for the order would take it. Asked about the total, which is less than 2 percent of the civilian workforce of 2.3 million, an official with the Office of Personnel Management said the number of employees who have accepted the offer “is growing.”
